description: Provides functionality similar to the "docker login" command.

tls.description: Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.

username.description: The username for the registry account

cacert_path.description: Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.

config_path.description: Custom path to the Docker CLI configuration file.

reauthorize.description: Refresh exiting authentication found in the configuration file.

ssl_version.description: Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.

docker_host.description: The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.

tls_hostname.description: When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.

state.description: This controls the current state of the user. C(present) will login in a user, C(absent) will log him out.

tls_verify.description: Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.

key_path.description: Path to the client's TLS key file.

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.

cert_path.description: Path to the client's TLS certificate file.

password.description: The plaintext password for the registry account

email.description: The email address for the registry account. NOTE: private registries may not require this, but Docker Hub requires it.

api_version.description: The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
